label: [Introspection] ClientCode: Convert RSS to Nodes
info: ::: aim Provide an example of the TriggerImport node that can be used to import dynamically generated flows. Demonstrate by converting an RSS feed to a Node-RED flow tab. ::: ::: requirements This requirements the following Node-RED nodes: - [introspection](https://flows.nodered.org/node/@gregoriusrippenstein/node-red-contrib-introspection), version >= 0.4.0 ::: ::: explanation **RSS to Nodes** The flow retrieves an RSS feed and for each entry, it generates a comment node. The ClientCode node is triggered once the flow contents have been created and it executes Javascript code in the client to open the Flow Import dialog. It the pastes the flow contents into the dialog. The nodes generated in the function node have the format: ```javascript msg.payload = { "id": msg.payload.id[0].match(/.{16}$/)[0], "type": "comment", "name": msg.payload.title[0]["_"], "info": msg.payload.id[0], "x": 801 * Math.random(), "y": 699 * Math.random(), "wires": [ ] } ``` The `id` (in this case) assumes that the orignal RSS id contains a 16 digit hexdecimal. This is an assumption that **only** works with this RSS feed. **Hello World** The hello world flow will simply open an alert window in the browser with *hello world* - the payload set in the inject node. :::

name: import RSS feed as comment Nodes
set payload and define fake tab Z id
convert xml object to flow object
prepend the subflow to the nodes array
Open import dialog
